Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can draw a detailed representation of the fish and other organisms, such as plants and other animals, that live in the habitat.
The student can accurately label different parts of the habitat, indicating where the fish, plants, and other living things are found.
The student can show the interaction between the fish and water, illustrating how the water supports the fish's need to swim.
The student can label resources, such as plants for food and water, that are necessary for the fish and other living organisms.
The student can demonstrate the interconnectedness of the habitat system, showing how fish, plants, and resources work together.
The student can depict how sunlight is used by plants within the habitat, indicating the flow of energy.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally mislabel a part due to oversight (e.g., not labeling a specific plant species).
The student might omit very minor elements of the system unintentionally (e.g., neglecting to show smaller rocks or insignificant details in the habitat structure).
